title: Musical legacy of Africans in Spain - claim

content.description:
“The frequency of black African characters playing songs and dancing who appear in Golden Age SpanishThe period of Spanish literature extending from the early 1500s to the late 1600s. comedies and short plays, as well as their mention in sociohistorical sources, is astonishing. In the light of this, the lack of awareness of present-day Spaniards about the presence of Africans in Spanish history is remarkable, particularly as Spain most probably had the largest black population in Renaissance Europe (Martín Casares 2005). Regardless of the fact that black Africans have been a significant element in the Spanish population for centuries, their importance has never been recognized.”
Source: Aurelia Martín-Casares and Marga G. Barranco, “The musical legacy of black Africans in Spain: A review of our sources,” Anthropological Notebooks, 2009
content.question: Which of the following best identifies evidence used by the authors to support their claim about the size of the African population in Spain?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify and explain a source's claim(s), evidence, and reasoning.
